posts.title: Deception Research
posts.content:
Researchers at the University of Portsmouth are interested in how memory fades over time, specifically the differences between this memory for truth tellers and liars.

In this study you will be allocated to one of two possible missions. Depending on which task you are allocated to, you may be required to lie when later interviewed about your mission. The study will be in two parts.

The first stage is comprised of the mission and interview (45-60 mins) and the second stage will be an interview two weeks later (20-30 mins).

All participants will be paid £10 for their participation. If you are able to tell a convincing story to the interviewer, you will be entered into a draw to win one of three possible prizes; £150, £100 and £50! The study will take part in King Henry Building.
posts.excerpt: Researchers at the University of Portsmouth are interested in how memory fades over time, specifically the differences between this memory for truth tellers and liars. In this study you will be allocated to…

customresearch: All participants will be paid £10 for their participation and all convincing interviewees will be entered into a draw to win one of three possible prizes; £150, £100 and £50!

posts.title: Identity Deception
posts.content:
Researchers at the University of Portsmouth are interested in false identity and our descriptions of past events, specifically the differences between such descriptions for truth tellers and liars.

In this study you will be allocated to one of two possible conditions. Depending on which task you are allocated to, you may be required to lie when later interviewed.

The study will take approximately 60-70 minutes (maximum) of your time, and will involve an interview. If you are interested in taking part, we will inform you of specific instructions and the condition in which you will be placed seven days before the study.

If you are able to tell a convincing story to the interviewer, you will be entered into a draw to win one of three possible prizes; £150, £100 and £50.
posts.excerpt: Researchers at the University of Portsmouth are interested in false identity and our descriptions of past events, specifically the differences between such descriptions for truth tellers and liars. In this study you will…

customresearch: 1st year psychology students who are part of the participant pool system are able to earn 1.5 credits for participation. All convincing interviewees will be entered into a draw to win one of three possible prizes; £150, £100 and £50.

posts.title: Truth, Lies and Memory
posts.content:
The study involves watching a video about a spy device and then being interviewed about it afterwards.

Depending on which condition you are in, you may be asked to lie during the interview. The study offers two additional conditions, an immediate and a delay.

In the immediate condition, you will watch the video and then be interviewed about it afterwards, and for this you are paid £10. The study will take no longer than 60 minutes.

In the delay condition, you are asked to watch the video and then return three weeks later for the interview, and for this you will be paid £15. The initial and second stage will be no longer than 30 minutes each (so a maximum of 60 minutes).
posts.excerpt: The study involves watching a video about a spy device and then being interviewed about it afterwards. Depending on which condition you are in, you may be asked to lie during the interview….

customresearch: Depending on the condition, participants are paid either £10 or £15. First year students who are part of participant pool are eligible to choose one credit in lieu of the monetary incentive.

posts.title: Honestly it was a great trip?
posts.title_plain: Honestly it was a great trip?
posts.content:
In this study you will be asked to either lie or tell the truth about a trip of a minimum of two nights that you took in the last year.

Both liars and truth tellers will be given time to research the city they ‘visited’. You will then fill out a short pre-interview questionnaire before being interviewed about your trip. After the interview you will fill out a post-interview questionnaire and receive a debrief about the study. You do not need to prepare anything in advance, as you will have time to research the city or recall your trip on the day.

You will be paid £10 for your time and if you are convincing you will also be entered into a draw to win up to £150.
posts.excerpt: In this study you will be asked to either lie or tell the truth about a trip of a minimum of two nights that you took in the last year. Both liars and…

posts.title: Calling for ACTORS! Earn £10
posts.content:
The study includes two parts.

  • Part 1 is a brief online pre-screening for previous negative life events in last 6 months (15 minutes). After the pre-screening, participants who fit the criteria for the study will be called for the Part 2 with detailed information. Link to the pre-screening (Part 1)
  • Part 2 in total will last 1.5 hours, and it will be performed at Portsmouth University, Faculty of Science, King Henry’s building.

The study will last about a 1.5 hours and it is a computer-based task and filling out questionnaires (no acting ;performance).Every participant will be rewarded with £10 for participation after they complete the study.

If you are a professional or amateur actor, we kindly ask you to join the study. Also, if you know people who might be interested in participating, please, share this post with them.
posts.excerpt: The study includes two parts. Part 1 is a brief online pre-screening for previous negative life events in last 6 months (15 minutes). After the pre-screening, participants who fit the criteria for the…

customother: All participants need to be either professional or amateur actors.
customresearch: For finishing BOTH parts of the study, participants will earn £10.

posts.title: Respondents’ perceptions of the accuracy of personality test feedback
posts.title_plain: Respondents’ perceptions of the accuracy of personality test feedback
posts.content:
The Department of Psychology is looking for participants to take part in an online study to help develop a new personality questionnaire. This study will allow them to examine how people perceive the accuracy of feedback they receive about their personality characteristics.

In the first part you will answer questions about your daily attitudes and behaviours. You will then be given feedback about your personality based on the questionnaire responses you have provided. You will then be asked to rate each element of this feedback with respect to how true you feel it is of you, in order to see how effective the questionnaire is at producing accurate feedback.

Please enter the survey here.

posts.title: Getting on your soapbox! Tell us your opinion on matters of interest!
posts.title_plain: Getting on your soapbox! Tell us your opinion on matters of interest!
posts.content: Participation would require approximately 40 minutes on only one occasion and would take place in the Department of Psychology, King Henry Building.Before their appointment, participants will receive an online questionnaire to rate the extent to which they agree or disagree with various political and social topics. On the appointment date, they will be asked to discuss their opinions regarding one of those topics with another participant. Lastly, participants will complete an online questionnaire.

customresearchtitle: Examining interactions between pairs discussing their opinions
customresearch: Volunteers will receive £5 and first year psychology students will receive one course credit for participating.

posts.title: Who’s the suspect?
posts.content:
We are seeking to recruit fluent or native English speakers for a study that investigates factors affecting people; memory and reporting of information for witnessed events.

Participants will view a video of a crime event and will then report details of the incident. Participants receive £5 for participation (30-40 minutes).
posts.excerpt: We are seeking to recruit fluent or native English speakers for a study that investigates factors affecting people; memory and reporting of information for witnessed events. Participants will view a video of a…

posts.title: Seeking female participants
posts.content:
The Research Group in Breast Health are recruiting females for a study investigating the effectiveness of different breast support garments during everyday tasks.

Participants must:

  • have a bra size 34 to 38 under band and C to E cup size
  • be aged between 18 and 30 years
  • be able to walk on a treadmill and to perform a range of everyday tasks

Participants will also be required to sit in a spa of warm water for a period of approximately five minutes (your head and face will not be underwater).
Participants must not have undertaken any form of breast surgery, not have ever given birth, and not have exposed their breasts to UV radiation within the last three months (i.e. more than 15 minutes of sunbathing or tanning).
posts.excerpt: The Research Group in Breast Health are recruiting females for a study investigating the effectiveness of different breast support garments during everyday tasks. Participants must: have a bra size 34 to 38 under…

customresearch: Each participant will receive two free bras or a bra set on completion of testing!
customdateschange: Testing will take place from 31 August 2016.
customduration: Participants would be required to attend a testing session lasting up to three hours.

posts.title: How does exercise make you feel? Research participants required.
posts.title_plain: How does exercise make you feel? Research participants required.
posts.content:
The Department of Sport and Exercise Science are recruiting participants for an exercise study to examine the effects of different exercise intensities on an individual’s emotions during a sub-maximal exercise test.

We are seeking healthy male and female staff and students, aged 18-39 years, who are not currently physically active (i.e. not participating in at least 30 minutes of physical activity on at least five days a week).  For those interested in emotion and health, this study provides an opportunity to learn about the effects of different feelings on behaviours, and can provide participants with an indication of their fitness levels using contemporary physiological measures.

We very much appreciate your participation.
posts.excerpt: The Department of Sport and Exercise are seeking participants for an exercise study to examine the effects of different exercise intensities on an individual’s emotions.

comments.name: Alida Bedford
comments.content: How come you never seem to be interested in people over 39?

customresearchtitle: Examining the relationship between exercise intensity and emotions during a sub-maximal exercise treadmill test
customother: Currently physically active (i.e. not participating in at least 30 minutes of physical activity on at least five days a week).
customresearch: If you decide to take part in the study you will need to visit the Spinnaker Building on four separate occasions. The first visit will involve health screening checks and an introduction to testing procedures, lasting around 30 minutes. The remaining three visits will last around 60 minutes each, involving completion of a sub-maximal exercise test, and various paper and pencil questionnaires to assess your mood and emotions.
customdateschange: Testing started in May and continues through to December
customduration: 4 visits, the first lasting 30 minutes and the rest 60 minutes
